author: KRISTINA WATROBSKI | Crisis in the Classroom

text: {p}A Massachusetts police department is facing backlash from its community for searching a local middle school for a copy of the controversial book \"Gender Queer.\"{/p}{p}The Great Barrington Police Department reportedly received a complaint earlier this month about a book containing \"concerning illustrations\" being made available to middle school students. The complainant, whose identity is not immediately clear, provided police with a photo showing characters from \"Gender Queer\" engaging in sexual acts, {a href=\"https://www.boston.com/news/schools/2023/12/20/police-called-great-barrington-middle-school-gender-queer-book/\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://www.boston.com/news/schools/2023/12/20/police-called-great-barrington-middle-school-gender-queer-book/\"}according{/a} to Boston.com.{/p}{p}\"Gender Queer\" has topped the American Library Association's list of most challenged books in recent years. The memoir, which accounts author Maia Kobabe's own exploration of gender identity, has {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/its-pornography-its-trash-father-tears-into-school-board-for-allowing-gender-queer-book-on-shelves-rhode-island-robert-chiaradio-westerly-public-school#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/its-pornography-its-trash-father-tears-into-school-board-for-allowing-gender-queer-book-on-shelves-rhode-island-robert-chiaradio-westerly-public-school#\"}sparked concerns{/a} in parents nationwide due to its sexually explicit content.{br}{/p}{p}Kobabe asserted in September that the book is {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/gender-queer-author-i-dont-recommend-this-book-for-kids-maia-kobabe-memoir-lgbt-gender-identity#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/gender-queer-author-i-dont-recommend-this-book-for-kids-maia-kobabe-memoir-lgbt-gender-identity#\"}not intended for children{/a}, saying it was written for \"older teens who were already asking these questions about themselves.\"{/p}{p}After searching a classroom in W.E.B. Du Bois Regional Middle School on Dec. 8, a Great Barrington police officer was reportedly told \"Gender Queer\" was \"not there and could not be accounted for at that time.\" However, the search sparked outrage in many, with community members calling the police department \"out of touch\" for responding to the complaint.{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/teachers-union-recommends-gender-queer-to-educators-for-summer-reading-national-education-association-nea-maia-kobabe-gender-identity-parents-school-students#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/teachers-union-recommends-gender-queer-to-educators-for-summer-reading-national-education-association-nea-maia-kobabe-gender-identity-parents-school-students#\"}Teachers union recommends 'Gender Queer' to educators for summer reading{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Great Barrington Police Chief Paul Storti apologized to anyone \"negatively\" affected by the search on Facebook last week.{/p}{p}\"I promise you our actions were not meant to disenfranchise anyone or influence school curriculum,\" Storti wrote in a statement. \"I wish to emphasize again to our residents, teachers, students and wider community that it is not our role to seek out, censor or 'ban books' in our schools.\"{/p}{p}However, others argued the police department has \"nothing to apologize for,\"{ They don’t have a choice to respond, they respond to all calls,\" one commenter said. \"They can’t pick and choose when to respond.\"{/p}{p}\"Keep enforcing the law and community standards,\" another added. \"As a Playboy has no place in public school neither does this book.\"{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/parents-call-cops-after-teacher-offers-lgbt-book-to-students-in-illinois-sarah-bonner-today-gay-lesbian-transgender-trans-heyworth-this-book-is-gay#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/parents-call-cops-after-teacher-offers-lgbt-book-to-students-in-illinois-sarah-bonner-today-gay-lesbian-transgender-trans-heyworth-this-book-is-gay#\"}Parents call cops after teacher offers 'This Book Is Gay' to middle schoolers in Illinois{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}\"Gender Queer\" has been removed from schools in several states, including Texas, Pennsylvania and Michigan. The New York State Education Department {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/state-dept-of-ed-promoted-book-depicting-sex-acts-says-it-was-unaware-of-content#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/state-dept-of-ed-promoted-book-depicting-sex-acts-says-it-was-unaware-of-content#\"}retracted{/a} its support of the book last year after becoming \"aware\" of its \"graphic nature.\"{br}{/p}{p}In September,{ }the memoir was used on the Senate floor as an example to support school book bans. Sen. John Kennedy, R-La., read a {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/senator-reads-explicit-passage-from-book-during-judiciary-hearing-to-make-point-on-book-bans-john-kennedy-all-boys-arent-blue-gender-queer-political-battle-public-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/senator-reads-explicit-passage-from-book-during-judiciary-hearing-to-make-point-on-book-bans-john-kennedy-all-boys-arent-blue-gender-queer-political-battle-public-libraries\"}passage {/a}discussing a character trying on a \"strap-on harness\" to prove that the book's contents are inappropriate for young students.{/p}{p}Crisis in the Classroom (CITC) reached out to the Berkshire Hills Regional School District for comment, but did not immediately receive a response.
